result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles Louis Summers was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bail Refund Packets
FILED:  ORIGINAL TRANSCRIPT (44 pages) of Plea and Sentencing held on 9-03-15 before the Honorable William S. Pocan.
Bail Refund Check Packet
9/9/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 60 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with any Full Service Car Wash Inc.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is stipulated by the parties and ordered in the amount of $906.43 to be paid to Full Service Car Wash Inc.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 24 months.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 12 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fines, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds,  any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan; Letters on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Charles Louis Summers in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading.
